verses.verse: And He went <S%G1831><s%> out from there, <S%G1564><s%> and He came <S%G2064><s%> into His home <S%G3968><s%> town; <S%G3968><s%> and His disciples <S%G3101><s%> followed <S%G190><s%> Him.

And when the Sabbath <S%G4521><s%> had come, <S%G1096><s%> He began <S%G757><s%> to teach <S%G1321><s%> in the synagogue; <S%G4864><s%> and the many <S%G4183><s%> listeners <S%G191><s%> were astonished, <S%G1605><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> "Where <S%G4159><s%> did this <S%G3778><s%> man <S%G3778><s%> [get] these <S%G3778><s%> things, <S%G3778><s%> and what <S%G5101><s%> is [this] wisdom <S%G4678><s%> given <S%G1325><s%> to Him, and such <S%G5108><s%> miracles <S%G1411><s%> as these <S%G5108><s%> performed <S%G1096><s%> by His hands <S%G5495><s%>?

"Is not this <S%G3778><s%> the carpenter, <S%G5045><s%> the son <S%G5207><s%> of Mary, <S%G3137><s%> and brother <S%G80><s%> of James, <S%G2385><s%> and Joses, <S%G2500><s%> and Judas, <S%G2455><s%> and Simon <S%G4613><s%>? Are not His sisters <S%G79><s%> here <S%G5602><s%> with us?" And they took <S%G4624><s%> offense <S%G4624><s%> at Him.

And Jesus <S%G2424><s%> said <S%G3004><s%> to them, "A prophet <S%G4396><s%> is not without <S%G820><s%> honor <S%G820><s%> except <S%G1508><s%> in his home <S%G3968><s%> town <S%G3968><s%> and among <S%G1722><s%> his [own] relatives <S%G4773><s%> and in his [own] household. <S%G3614><s%>"

And He could <S%G1410><s%> do <S%G4160><s%> no <S%G3756><s%> <S%G3762><s%> miracle <S%G1411><s%> there <S%G1563><s%> except <S%G1508><s%> that He laid <S%G2007><s%> His hands <S%G5495><s%> upon a few <S%G3641><s%> sick <S%G732><s%> people <S%G732><s%> and healed <S%G2323><s%> them.
And He wondered <S%G2296><s%> at their unbelief. <S%G570><s%> And He was going <S%G4013><s%> around <S%G4013><s%> <S%G2945><s%> the villages <S%G2968><s%> teaching. <S%G1321><s%>

And He summoned <S%G4341><s%> the twelve <S%G1427><s%> and began <S%G757><s%> to send <S%G649><s%> them out in pairs; <S%G1417><s%> and He was giving <S%G1325><s%> them authority <S%G1849><s%> over the unclean <S%G169><s%> spirits; <S%G4151><s%>

and He instructed <S%G3853><s%> them that they should take <S%G142><s%> nothing <S%G3367><s%> for [their] journey, <S%G3598><s%> except <S%G1508><s%> a mere <S%G3441><s%> staff; <S%G4464><s%> no <S%G3361><s%> bread, <S%G740><s%> no <S%G3361><s%> bag, <S%G4082><s%> no <S%G3361><s%> money <S%G5475><s%> in their belt; <S%G2223><s%>
but [to] wear <S%G5265><s%> sandals; <S%G4547><s%> and [He added], "Do not put <S%G1746><s%> on two <S%G1417><s%> tunics. <S%G5509><s%>"

And He said <S%G3004><s%> to them, "Wherever <S%G3699><s%> <S%G1437><s%> you enter <S%G1525><s%> a house, <S%G3614><s%> stay <S%G3306><s%> there <S%G1563><s%> until <S%G2193><s%> you leave <S%G1831><s%> town. <S%G1564><s%>

"And any <S%G3739><s%> <S%G302><s%> place <S%G5117><s%> that does not receive <S%G1209><s%> you or <S%G3366><s%> listen <S%G191><s%> to you, as you go <S%G1607><s%> out from there, <S%G1564><s%> shake <S%G1621><s%> off <S%G1621><s%> the dust <S%G5529><s%> from the soles <S%G5270><s%> of your feet <S%G4228><s%> for a testimony <S%G3142><s%> against them."
And they went <S%G1831><s%> out and preached <S%G2784><s%> that [men] should repent. <S%G3340><s%>

And they were casting <S%G1544><s%> out many <S%G4183><s%> demons <S%G1140><s%> and were anointing <S%G218><s%> with oil <S%G1637><s%> many <S%G4183><s%> sick <S%G732><s%> people <S%G732><s%> and healing <S%G2323><s%> them.

And King <S%G935><s%> Herod <S%G2264><s%> heard <S%G191><s%> [of it,] for His name <S%G3686><s%> had become <S%G1096><s%> well <S%G5318><s%> known; <S%G5318><s%> and [people] were saying, <S%G3004><s%> "John <S%G2491><s%> the Baptist <S%G907><s%> has risen <S%G1453><s%> from the dead, <S%G3498><s%> and that is why <S%G1223><s%> these <S%G3588><s%> miraculous <S%G1411><s%> powers <S%G1411><s%> are at work <S%G1754><s%> in Him."

But others <S%G243><s%> were saying, <S%G3004><s%> "He is Elijah. <S%G2243><s%>" And others <S%G243><s%> were saying, <S%G3004><s%> "[He is] a prophet, <S%G4396><s%> like <S%G5613><s%> one <S%G1520><s%> of the prophets <S%G4396><s%> [of old."]
But when Herod <S%G2264><s%> heard <S%G191><s%> [of it,] he kept saying, <S%G3004><s%> "John, <S%G2491><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> I beheaded, <S%G607><s%> has risen! <S%G1453><s%>"

For Herod <S%G2264><s%> himself <S%G846><s%> had sent <S%G649><s%> and had John <S%G2491><s%> arrested <S%G2902><s%> and bound <S%G1210><s%> in prison <S%G5438><s%> on account <S%G1223><s%> of Herodias, <S%G2266><s%> the wife <S%G1135><s%> of his brother <S%G80><s%> Philip, <S%G5376><s%> because <S%G3754><s%> he had married <S%G1060><s%> her.
For John <S%G2491><s%> had been saying <S%G3004><s%> to Herod, <S%G2264><s%> "It is not lawful <S%G1832><s%> for you to have <S%G2192><s%> your brother's wife. <S%G1135><s%>"

And Herodias <S%G2266><s%> had <S%G1758><s%> a grudge <S%G1758><s%> against <S%G1758><s%> him and wanted <S%G2309><s%> to put <S%G615><s%> him to death <S%G615><s%> and could <S%G1410><s%> not [do so;]

for Herod <S%G2264><s%> was afraid <S%G5399><s%> of John, <S%G2491><s%> knowing <S%G3609><s%> that he was a righteous <S%G1342><s%> and holy <S%G40><s%> man, <S%G435><s%> and kept <S%G4933><s%> him safe. <S%G4933><s%> And when he heard <S%G191><s%> him, he was very <S%G4183><s%> perplexed; <S%G639><s%> but he used to enjoy <S%G2234><s%> listening <S%G191><s%> to him.

And a strategic <S%G2121><s%> day <S%G2250><s%> came <S%G1096><s%> when <S%G3753><s%> Herod <S%G2264><s%> on his birthday <S%G1077><s%> gave <S%G4160><s%> a banquet <S%G1173><s%> for his lords <S%G3175><s%> and military <S%G5506><s%> commanders <S%G5506><s%> and the leading <S%G4413><s%> men <S%G4413><s%> of Galilee; <S%G1056><s%>

and when the daughter <S%G2364><s%> of Herodias <S%G2266><s%> herself <S%G846><s%> came <S%G1525><s%> in and danced, <S%G3738><s%> she pleased <S%G700><s%> Herod <S%G2264><s%> and his dinner <S%G4873><s%> guests; <S%G4873><s%> and the king <S%G935><s%> said <S%G3004><s%> to the girl, <S%G2877><s%> "Ask <S%G154><s%> me for whatever <S%G3739><s%> <S%G1437><s%> you want <S%G2309><s%> and I will give <S%G1325><s%> it to you."
And he swore <S%G3660><s%> to her, "Whatever <S%G3739><s%> <S%G1437><s%> you ask <S%G154><s%> of me, I will give <S%G1325><s%> it to you; up to half <S%G2255><s%> of my kingdom. <S%G932><s%>"

And she went <S%G1831><s%> out and said <S%G3004><s%> to her mother, <S%G3384><s%> "What <S%G5101><s%> shall I ask <S%G154><s%> for?" And she said, <S%G3004><s%> "The head <S%G2776><s%> of John <S%G2491><s%> the Baptist. <S%G907><s%>"

And immediately <S%G2117><s%> she came <S%G1525><s%> in haste <S%G4710><s%> before <S%G4314><s%> the king <S%G935><s%> and asked, <S%G154><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> "I want <S%G2309><s%> you to give <S%G1325><s%> me right <S%G1824><s%> away <S%G1824><s%> the head <S%G2776><s%> of John <S%G2491><s%> the Baptist <S%G910><s%> on a platter. <S%G4094><s%>"

And although the king <S%G935><s%> was very <S%G4036><s%> sorry, <S%G4036><s%> [yet] because <S%G1223><s%> of his oaths <S%G3727><s%> and because of his dinner <S%G345><s%> guests, <S%G345><s%> he was unwilling <S%G3756><s%> <S%G2309><s%> to refuse <S%G114><s%> her.

And immediately <S%G2117><s%> the king <S%G935><s%> sent <S%G649><s%> an executioner <S%G4688><s%> and commanded <S%G2004><s%> [him] to bring <S%G5342><s%> [back] his head. <S%G2776><s%> And he went <S%G565><s%> and had him beheaded <S%G607><s%> in the prison, <S%G5438><s%>

and brought <S%G5342><s%> his head <S%G2776><s%> on a platter, <S%G4094><s%> and gave <S%G1325><s%> it to the girl; <S%G2877><s%> and the girl <S%G2877><s%> gave <S%G1325><s%> it to her mother. <S%G3384><s%>

And when his disciples <S%G3101><s%> heard <S%G191><s%> [about this,] they came <S%G2064><s%> and took <S%G142><s%> away <S%G142><s%> his body <S%G4430><s%> and laid <S%G5087><s%> it in a tomb. <S%G3419><s%>

And the apostles <S%G652><s%> gathered <S%G4863><s%> together <S%G4863><s%> with Jesus; <S%G2424><s%> and they reported <S%G518><s%> to Him all <S%G3956><s%> that they had done <S%G4160><s%> and taught. <S%G1321><s%>

And He said <S%G3004><s%> to them, "Come <S%G1205><s%> away <S%G1205><s%> by yourselves <S%G4771><s%> <S%G846><s%> to a lonely <S%G2048><s%> place <S%G5117><s%> and rest <S%G373><s%> a while. <S%G3641><s%>" (For there were many <S%G4183><s%> [people] coming <S%G2064><s%> and going, <S%G5217><s%> and they did not even <S%G3761><s%> have <S%G2119><s%> time <S%G2119><s%> to eat. <S%G2068><s%>)
And they went <S%G565><s%> away <S%G565><s%> in the boat <S%G4143><s%> to a lonely <S%G2048><s%> place <S%G5117><s%> by themselves. <S%G2398><s%>

And [the people] saw <S%G3708><s%> them going, <S%G5217><s%> and many <S%G4183><s%> recognized <S%G1921><s%> [them,] and they ran <S%G4936><s%> there <S%G1563><s%> together <S%G4936><s%> on foot <S%G3979><s%> from all <S%G3956><s%> the cities, <S%G4172><s%> and got <S%G4281><s%> there <S%G4281><s%> ahead <S%G4281><s%> of them.

And when He went <S%G1831><s%> ashore, <S%G1831><s%> He saw <S%G3708><s%> a great <S%G4183><s%> multitude, <S%G3793><s%> and He felt <S%G4697><s%> compassion <S%G4697><s%> for them because <S%G3754><s%> they were like <S%G5613><s%> sheep <S%G4263><s%> without <S%G3361><s%> <S%G2192><s%> a shepherd; <S%G4166><s%> and He began <S%G757><s%> to teach <S%G1321><s%> them many <S%G4183><s%> things. <S%G4183><s%>

And when it was already <S%G2235><s%> quite <S%G4183><s%> late, <S%G5610><s%> <S%G4183><s%> His disciples <S%G3101><s%> came <S%G4334><s%> up to Him and [began] saying, <S%G3004><s%> "The place <S%G5117><s%> is desolate <S%G2048><s%> and it is already <S%G2235><s%> quite <S%G4183><s%> late <S%G5610><s%>; <S%G4183><s%>

send <S%G630><s%> them away <S%G630><s%> so <S%G2443><s%> that they may go <S%G565><s%> into the surrounding <S%G2945><s%> countryside <S%G68><s%> and villages <S%G2968><s%> and buy <S%G59><s%> themselves <S%G1438><s%> something <S%G5101><s%> to eat. <S%G2068><s%> "

But He answered <S%G611><s%> and said <S%G3004><s%> to them, "You give <S%G1325><s%> them [something] to eat! <S%G2068><s%>" And they said <S%G3004><s%> to Him, "Shall we go <S%G565><s%> and spend <S%G59><s%> two <S%G1250><s%> hundred <S%G1250><s%> denarii <S%G1220><s%> on bread <S%G740><s%> and give <S%G1325><s%> them [something] to eat <S%G2068><s%>? "

And He said <S%G3004><s%> to them, "How <S%G4214><s%> many <S%G4214><s%> loaves <S%G740><s%> do you have <S%G2192><s%>? Go <S%G5217><s%> look! <S%G3708><s%>" And when they found <S%G1097><s%> out, they said, <S%G3004><s%> "Five <S%G4002><s%> and two <S%G1417><s%> fish. <S%G2486><s%>"
And He commanded <S%G2004><s%> them all <S%G3956><s%> to recline <S%G347><s%> by groups <S%G4849><s%> on the green <S%G5515><s%> grass. <S%G5528><s%>
And they reclined <S%G377><s%> in companies <S%G4237><s%> of hundreds <S%G1540><s%> and of fifties. <S%G4004><s%>

And He took <S%G2983><s%> the five <S%G4002><s%> loaves <S%G740><s%> and the two <S%G1417><s%> fish, <S%G2486><s%> and looking <S%G308><s%> up toward <S%G1519><s%> heaven, <S%G3772><s%> He blessed <S%G2127><s%> [the food] and broke <S%G2622><s%> the loaves <S%G740><s%> and He kept giving <S%G1325><s%> [them] to the disciples <S%G3101><s%> to set <S%G3908><s%> before <S%G3908><s%> them; and He divided <S%G3307><s%> up the two <S%G1417><s%> fish <S%G2486><s%> among them all. <S%G3956><s%>
And they all <S%G3956><s%> ate <S%G2068><s%> and were satisfied. <S%G5526><s%>
And they picked <S%G142><s%> up twelve <S%G1427><s%> full <S%G4138><s%> baskets <S%G2894><s%> of the broken <S%G2801><s%> pieces, <S%G2801><s%> and also of the fish. <S%G2486><s%>
And there were five <S%G4000><s%> thousand <S%G4000><s%> men <S%G435><s%> who ate <S%G2068><s%> the loaves. <S%G740><s%>

And immediately <S%G2117><s%> He made <S%G315><s%> His disciples <S%G3101><s%> get <S%G1684><s%> into the boat <S%G4143><s%> and go <S%G4254><s%> ahead <S%G4254><s%> of [Him] to the other <S%G4008><s%> side <S%G4008><s%> to Bethsaida, <S%G966><s%> while <S%G2193><s%> He Himself <S%G846><s%> was sending <S%G630><s%> the multitude <S%G3793><s%> away. <S%G630><s%>
And after bidding <S%G657><s%> them farewell, <S%G657><s%> He departed <S%G565><s%> to the mountain <S%G3735><s%> to pray. <S%G4336><s%>
And when it was evening, <S%G3798><s%> the boat <S%G4143><s%> was in the midst <S%G3319><s%> of the sea, <S%G2281><s%> and He [was] alone <S%G3441><s%> on the land. <S%G1093><s%>

And seeing <S%G3708><s%> them straining <S%G928><s%> at the oars, <S%G1643><s%> for the wind <S%G417><s%> was against <S%G1727><s%> them, at about <S%G4012><s%> the fourth <S%G5067><s%> watch <S%G5438><s%> of the night, <S%G3571><s%> He came <S%G2064><s%> to them, walking <S%G4043><s%> on the sea; <S%G2281><s%> and He intended <S%G2309><s%> to pass <S%G3928><s%> by them.
But when they saw <S%G3708><s%> Him walking <S%G4043><s%> on the sea, <S%G2281><s%> they supposed <S%G1380><s%> that it was a ghost, <S%G5326><s%> and cried <S%G349><s%> out;

for they all <S%G3956><s%> saw <S%G3708><s%> Him and were frightened. <S%G5015><s%> But immediately <S%G2117><s%> He spoke <S%G2980><s%> with them and said <S%G3004><s%> to them, "Take <S%G2293><s%> courage; <S%G2293><s%> it is I, do not be afraid. <S%G5399><s%>"

And He got <S%G305><s%> into the boat <S%G4143><s%> with them, and the wind <S%G417><s%> stopped; <S%G2869><s%> and they were greatly <S%G3029><s%> <S%G1537><s%> <S%G4053><s%> astonished, <S%G1839><s%>
for they had not gained <S%G4920><s%> any insight <S%G4920><s%> from the [incident of] the loaves, <S%G740><s%> but their heart <S%G2588><s%> was hardened. <S%G4456><s%>
And when they had crossed <S%G1276><s%> over <S%G1276><s%> they came <S%G2064><s%> to land <S%G1093><s%> at Gennesaret, <S%G1082><s%> and moored <S%G4358><s%> to the shore.
And when they had come <S%G1831><s%> out of the boat, <S%G4143><s%> immediately <S%G2117><s%> [the people] recognized <S%G1921><s%> Him,

and ran <S%G4063><s%> about <S%G4063><s%> that whole <S%G3650><s%> country <S%G5561><s%> and began <S%G757><s%> to carry <S%G4064><s%> about <S%G4064><s%> on their pallets <S%G2895><s%> those <S%G3588><s%> who were sick, <S%G2560><s%> to the place <S%G3699><s%> they heard <S%G191><s%> He was.

And wherever <S%G3699><s%> <S%G302><s%> He entered <S%G1531><s%> villages, <S%G2968><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> cities, <S%G4172><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> countryside, <S%G68><s%> they were laying <S%G5087><s%> the sick <S%G770><s%> in the market <S%G58><s%> places, <S%G58><s%> and entreating <S%G3870><s%> Him that they might just <S%G2579><s%> touch <S%G681><s%> the fringe <S%G2899><s%> of His cloak; <S%G2440><s%> and as many <S%G3745><s%> as touched <S%G681><s%> it were being cured. <S%G4982><s%>
